20110128180555.000|20110128180557.000|TR0|much more long standing, is that Egypt has 
20110128180557.000|20110128180600.000|TR0|been our closest ally in the Middle East 
20110128180600.000|20110128180603.000|TR0|for a long time.  They are the only 
20110128180603.000|20110128180605.000|TR0|country, other than Jordan, that has a 
20110128180605.000|20110128180608.000|TR0|peace treaty with Israel and they are, in 
20110128180608.000|20110128180610.000|TR0|many ways, or have been seen to be the 
20110128180610.000|20110128180613.000|TR0|center of the Arab world, and Egypt is a 
20110128180613.000|20110128180616.000|TR0|very complex society.  It's got Islamic 
20110128180616.000|20110128180618.000|TR0|elements.  It's got a middle class. It's 
20110128180618.000|20110128180621.000|TR0|got the century's old civilization, 
20110128180621.000|20110128180623.000|TR0|Alexandria, where these things are taking

20110128183408.000|20110128183410.000|TR0|ignorant and finally, they manhandled all 
20110128183410.000|20110128183413.000|TR0|of us, you know, grabbed my camera, all of 
20110128183413.000|20110128183416.000|TR0|our hands were on it to try to get it.  
20110128183416.000|20110128183418.000|TR0|They grabbed it, threw it to the ground, 
20110128183418.000|20110128183421.000|TR0|you know, smashed it up, tool it and ran 
20110128183421.000|20110128183423.000|TR0|off, essentially.

20110128185721.000|20110128185724.000|TR0|Egyptians were a key factor in all of that.
20110128185724.000|20110128185727.000|TR0|
20110128185727.000|20110128185729.000|TR0|So, it's not a one-sided story.  I agree 
20110128185729.000|20110128185732.000|TR0|that we had to put more emphasis on the 
20110128185732.000|20110128185734.000|TR0|growth of the Democratic intuitions.
20110128185734.000|20110128185737.000|TR0|
20110128185737.000|20110128185739.000|TR0|GORANI:  And Ambassador, now is it sort of 
20110128185739.000|20110128185742.000|TR0|-- not too late -- but now has a situation 
20110128185742.000|20110128185745.000|TR0|so complicated come from 30 years of this 
20110128185745.000|20110128185747.000|TR0|authoritarian regime where really, 
20110128185747.000|20110128185750.000|TR0|opposition parties have pretty much been 
20110128185750.000|20110128185752.000|TR0|suffocated?
20110128185752.000|20110128185755.000|TR0|
20110128185755.000|20110128185758.000|TR0|CLANCY:  Well, there was peace between 
20110128185758.000|20110128185800.000|TR0|Egypt and Israel 30 years ago.
20110128185800.000|20110128185803.000|TR0|
20110128185803.000|20110128185805.000|TR0|GORANI:  Well, no, but nobody - no, and 
20110128185805.000|20110128185808.000|TR0|that's a good thing.  But inside of Egypt, 
20110128185808.000|20110128185810.000|TR0|what happens now?  Has the wide spectrum, 
20110128185810.000|20110128185813.000|TR0|the diverse spectrum of a pluralistic 
20110128185813.000|20110128185816.000|TR0|political system been made impossible to 
20110128185816.000|20110128185818.000|TR0|implement right now without some sort of 
20110128185818.000|20110128185821.000|TR0|military control?
20110128185821.000|20110128185823.000|TR0|
20110128185823.000|20110128185826.000|TR0|WALKER:  I'm not sure -- look, you can --

20110128185828.000|20110128185831.000|TR0|agree with those who say it's not going to 
20110128185831.000|20110128185834.000|TR0|shoot on the protestors.  It would be the 
20110128185834.000|20110128185836.000|TR0|death knell of the military and the regime 
20110128185836.000|20110128185839.000|TR0|if that happened.
20110128185839.000|20110128185841.000|TR0|
20110128185841.000|20110128185844.000|TR0|But the military does not necessarily have 
20110128185844.000|20110128185847.000|TR0|to be supporting Mubarak.  In Tunisia, the 
20110128185847.000|20110128185849.000|TR0|military did not support the Ben Ali.  
20110128185849.000|20110128185852.000|TR0|There is a way to pull back from the brink 
20110128185852.000|20110128185854.000|TR0|here.  I mean, the man has been in power 
20110128185854.000|20110128185857.000|TR0|for 30 years and the place has gone to -- 
20110128185857.000|20110128185859.000|TR0|has not really accomplished what people 
20110128185859.000|20110128185902.000|TR0|had hoped to -- it could.
20110128185902.000|20110128185905.000|TR0|
20110128185905.000|20110128185907.000|TR0|So, I think the military still has a role 
20110128185907.000|20110128185910.000|TR0|to play, but it would be very unlikely to 
20110128185910.000|20110128185912.000|TR0|try and take over as a military 
20110128185912.000|20110128185915.000|TR0|dictatorship.  It would be a transitional 
20110128185915.000|20110128185918.000|TR0|period while the parliament was reelected
